definition: (of a city etc) ablaze with lights

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Far below the plane we could see the lights of London.
sentences.chinese: 从飞机上俯视远处可以看到伦敦的万家灯火。

sentences.english: Do you remember all the city lights on the water.
sentences.chinese: 你还记得万家灯火映照在水上的景象吗？

sentences.english: Light across lamps and candles of a myriad families lonely, desolate nobody heard the story.
sentences.chinese: 万家灯火照亮了隔岸的寂寞，荒芜的故事无人听说。

sentences.english: When I was young I love to see in the night lamps and candles of a myriad families.
sentences.chinese: 小时候的我最喜欢看夜幕中的万家灯火。

definition: early evening when lanterns are first lit
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
many stars/a vast sky full of stars
night scene/the dim light of night
the sun sets in the west (idiom)
